issue.title: VRC Gates are Kryptonite for Visual Odometry

content.raw:
In addition to sensor noise real-world light also produces smooth shadows and shading on objects which also helps stereo vision and VO more than one would expect. In Gazebo each triangle has a constant amount of light/shading which makes it perform much worse than in a real-world scenario where lighting would create more "features" and make features more distinguishable. 
This could be avoided by rendering lighting effects into the texture using an external graphics program. The texture on Atlas and Polaris are good examples for texture with proper light effects baked into it. For example Polaris' blue front isn't simply constant colored blue but rather properly shaded as a result of ambient occlusion and other effects induced by light.

This applies not just to the gates but also to other objects such as the gas station and one of the buildings (which you agreed to change [here](#!/osrf/drcsim/pull-request/144/three-vrc-worlds/)).
